document_data.name: ''Psalms to the Old Oak''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Psalms to the Old Oak''''' was a collection of songs and poems dedicated to [[Silvanus]], the Forest Father.
document_data.Description: ''Psalms to the Old Oak'' was a stone tablet, carved with works venerating the druidic deity Silvanus.
document_data.Content:
{{quote|'' The leaves are His, and the trees are Him. To nurture this is our duty. To neglect them is to neglect our very Father.
The grass is His, and the blades are Him. It soothes our senses and softens our fall. To touch it is to know Him.
The fire is His, and the flames are Him. To fear them is to know His might. To stoke them is to shun His words.
Silvanus, grant us pease. Silvanus, grant us might. Silvanus, quell our malice.''|Excerpt from the ''Psalms to the Old Oak''}}
document_data.History: In 1492 DR, ''Psalms to the Old Oak'' were kept by the [[druid]]s on the [[Emerald Grove]] in the [[Western Heartlands]].
